H0.text: A sand dune is the feature most likely the result of a flowing river.

H1.text: A volcano is the feature most likely the result of a flowing river.

H2.text: A canyon is most likely the result of a flowing river.

H3.text: A glacier is the feature most likely the result of a flowing river.

A4.text: A canyon is a deep cleft between escarpments or cliffs resulting from weathering and the erosive activity of a river over geologic time scales.

A5.text: Rivers have a natural tendency to cut through underlying surfaces, eventually wearing away rock layers and forming canyons.
